name: Fraction, decimal and percentage equivalence - method selection 5

skills.name: Convert decimals greater than 1 to percentages
Write a fraction with a single digit denominator as a recurring decimal
Solve problems involving converting between fractions, decimals and percentages

explanations.A: We can't just put the denominator as the number after the decimal. To convert from fractions to decimals we need to divide the numerator by the denominator.
explanations.B: To convert from fractions to decimals we need to divide the numerator by the denominator. Just check your division.
explanations.C: To convert from fractions to decimals we need to divide the numerator by the denominator. 1 divided by 6 = 0 carry 1. We then put the decimal point in and some 0s to put the remainders on. 10 divided by 6 = 1 remainder 4. 40 divided by 6 is 6 remainder 4. 40 divided by 6 is 6 remainder 4, and this will continue forever.
explanations.D: We can't just put the denominator as the number after the decimal. To convert from fractions to decimals we need to divide the numerator by the denominator.

explanations.A: To convert from fractions to decimals we need to divide the numerator by the denominator. 1 divided by 9 = 0 carry 1. We then put the decimal point in and some 0s to put the remainders on. 10 divided by 1 = 1 remainder 1. 10 divided by 9 is 1 remainder 1 and this will continue forever.
explanations.B: We can't just put the denominator as the number after the decimal. To convert from fractions to decimals we need to divide the numerator by the denominator.
explanations.C: We can't just put the denominator as the number after the decimal. To convert from fractions to decimals we need to divide the numerator by the denominator.
explanations.D: We can't just put the numerator and denominator as the numbers after the decimal. To convert from fractions to decimals we need to divide the numerator by the denominator.

explanations.A: 0.8 is 8 tenths or 8/10 = 4/5 so Tom is correct. To go from decimals to percentages we multiply by 100, so 0.8 = 80%. That means Katie is incorrect
explanations.B: Not quite. Think about the place value of the 8, and also remember we multiply decimals by 100 to change them into percentages
explanations.C: Not quite. Remember we multiply decimals by 100 to change them into percentages
explanations.D: Not quite, at least one person is correct. Think about the place value of the 8, and also remember we multiply decimals by 100 to change them into percentages

explanations.A: Almost. Remember we multiply decimals by 100 to change them into percentages
explanations.B: Almost. Remember 0.02 is two hundredths. Could you simplify that fraction?
explanations.C: 0.02 is 2 hundredths = 2/100 which can be simplified to 1/50. To go from a decimal to a percentage we x by 100, so 0.02 = 2%. Both Tom and Katie are correct
explanations.D: At least one person is correct Remember 0.02 is two hundredths. Could you simplify that fraction? Also, to go from decimals to percentages we x by 100

explanations.A: To convert from decimals to percentages, we need to multiply by 100. 1.3 x 100 =130.
explanations.B: It looks like you have multiplied the number by 10. To convert to a percentage we need to multiply by 100.
explanations.C: When we convert a decimal to a percentage, we can't just put a percentage sign on the end. We need to multiply by 100.
explanations.D: We need to multiply by 100 to convert from a decimal to a percentage. Try checking your calculation.

explanations.A: When we convert a decimal to a percentage, we can't just put a percentage sign on the end. We need to multiply by 100.
explanations.B: We need to multiply by 100 to convert from a decimal to a percentage. Try checking your calculation.
explanations.C: To convert from decimals to percentages, we need to multiply by 100. 1.9 x 100 =190.
explanations.D: It looks like you have multiplied the number by 10. To convert to a percentage we need to multiply by 100.

explanations.A: It looks like something has happened with your conversion from fraction to percentage. You need to find an equivalent fraction for 1/20 that is out of 100. 1/20 = ?/100. What will you need to multiply the denominator by to make this happen? Do the same to the numerator to make sure the fraction is equivalent.
explanations.B: It looks like something has happened with your conversion from fraction to decimal. To solve this, you divide the numerator (top) by the denominator (bottom). Setting up bus stop method can help for your division.
explanations.C: We need to convert from fraction to decimal, so 1 divided by 20 is equal to 0.05. To convert from fraction to percentage we find the equivalent fraction of 1/20, which is 5/100. 'percentage' means out of 100. Therefore 5/100 equals 5%.
explanations.D: Try converting from fraction to decimal, by dividing the numerator (top) by the denominator (bottom). Then convert from fraction to percentage by finding the equivalent fraction of 1/20. Remember 'percentage' means out of 100.

explanations.A: We need to convert from fraction to decimal, so 3 divided by 5 is equal to 0.6. The convert from fraction to percentage we find the equivalent fraction of 3/5 with a denominator of 100, which is 60/100. 'percentage' means out of 100. Therefore 60/100 equals 60%. Showing only Tom is correct.
explanations.B: Try converting from fraction to decimal, by dividing the numerator (top) by the denominator (bottom). Then convert from fraction to percentage by finding the equivalent fraction of 3/5, that has a denominator of 100. Remember 'percentage' means out of 100.
explanations.C: It looks like something has happened with your conversion from fraction to percentage. Remember to find an equivalent fraction for 3/5 that is out of 100. 'percentage' means out of 100, therefore you can convert from your equivalent fraction to your percentage. Then compare to the statements given.
explanations.D: Try converting from fraction to decimal, by dividing the numerator (top) by the denominator (bottom). Then convert from fraction to percentage by finding the equivalent fraction of 3/5, that has a denominator of 100. Remember 'percentage' means out of 100.

explanations.A: Remember that 'percentage' means out of 100. Try writing 7% as a fraction over 100. To convert from percentage to decimal we divide by 100, which means each place value moves two places to the right.
explanations.B: percentage' means out of 100. Which means 7% is equivalent to 7/100 not 7/10. To convert from percentage to decimal we divide by 100, each place value moves two places to the right. Therefore 7 divided by 100 is equal to 0.07. Showing that only Katie is correct.
explanations.C: Remember that 'percentage' means out of 100. Try writing 7% as a fraction over 100.
explanations.D: Remember that 'percentage' means out of 100. Try writing 7% as a fraction over 100. To convert from percentage to decimal we divide by 100, which means each place value moves two places to the right. Try dividing 7 by 100.

explanations.A: Remember that 'percentage' means out of 100. Try writing 35% as a fraction over 100 and then simplify it. To convert from percentage to decimal we divide by 100, which means each place value moves two places to the right.
explanations.B: percentage' means out of 100. Which means 35% is equivalent to 35/100 and simplifies to 7/20, not 3/5. To convert from percentage to decimal we divide by 100, each place value moves two places to the right. Therefore 35 divided by 100 is equal to 0.35. Showing that only Katie is correct.
explanations.C: Remember that 'percentage' means out of 100. Try writing 35% as a fraction over 100 and simplify if possible.
explanations.D: Remember that 'percentage' means out of 100. Try writing 35% as a fraction over 100 and simplify if possible. To convert from percentage to decimal we divide by 100, which means each place value moves two places to the right. Try dividing 35 by 100.
